meanings.definition: To select or extract a passage from a larger work for quoting or summarizing.
meanings.sent1: When writing a research paper, I will be excerpting important information from various sources.
meanings.sent2: The journalist was excerpting key points from the interview to include in the article.
meanings.sent3: The teacher joked that she was excerpting the most exciting part of the story to keep the students engaged.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a detective, excerpting clues from the text to solve the mystery.
meanings.sent5: Her skill in excerpting made the complex text easier to understand for the class.

meanings.definition: The act of taking a portion of text from a larger work for use in another context.
meanings.sent1: Excerpting is a common practice in academic writing to support arguments.
meanings.sent2: The excerpting of quotes from famous speeches adds credibility to the presentation.
meanings.sent3: During the play, the actor's comedic excerpting of lines had the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent4: In the art of storytelling, excerpting can create suspense and intrigue for the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The skillful excerpting of details brought life to the historical narrative.
